description:
百团大战来啦！
寒风阵阵也挡不住的沪江团购【百团大战】火热打响！
百种商品5折包邮，限量100件火热抢购，每天都有新惊喜。
劲享超值团购体验     立即开抢>>

备战四六级、中高口......各种英语考试的你想要冲击高分？
听力不过关，英语高分谈何容易！
这搜搜那里下下，永远为搜集资料浪费大量时间，最终落得兴趣全无？
英语高分，流利听说，从现在开始起步！
《跟大牌主播学新闻英语》汇编CNN、VOA、NPR三大新闻社百篇精选新闻。
多角度、循序渐进学习新闻英语，大牌主播原声音频，助你学习标准口语发音，说出大牌风范。

英文听说要有大牌风范！

本团包含：
《跟大牌主播学新闻英语》 1册（内含大牌主播纯正美式发音MP3光盘 1张+沪江网校20元学习卡 1张）
温馨提示：本书内含学习卡有效期至2015年12月31日，请尽快使用，过期作废。

《跟大牌主播学新闻英语》汇编了CNN、VOA、NPR三大新闻社135篇英语精华新闻，涉及领域广、用词精准，是提高听力水平的合适切入点，同时也是现有各种听力考试形式中的侧重点。然而，由于新闻听力语速快、信息量大，它又是英语听力中的难点所在。本书按新闻语速分为慢速、标准、快速三个部分，让读者从“适应-提高-挑战”这三个阶段循序渐进增强自己的听力水平。

本书适用于想要在听力理解部分获得高分的人群，如准备参加英语专业四、八级考试和大学英语四、六级考试的学生，也可以作为英语专业、大学英语和研究生英语听力课程教材。同时，对于参加出国能力认证考试如托福（TOFEL）、雅思 （IELTS）、美国研究生入学考试（GRE）等的考生来说，本书也是难得的训练用书。

主要特色：
1. 有价值的大牌主播原声新闻：精心节选VOA、CNN、NPR明星主播原声音频，让你品味音质纯正、原汁原味的地道美音。
2. 权威的新闻资讯：收录三大新闻社新闻英语精华，涵盖时事、财经、文化、科技、军事、教育、娱乐等众多方面。
3. 有效的学习方式：每篇新闻均由6大版块构成，每天5分钟，新闻英语一本尽掌握：
　　30秒速读新闻背景——快速了解新闻相关背景信息！
　　1分钟新闻现场——原汁原味新闻报道零距离接触！
　　1分钟边听边读——精准译文助您更好地理解新闻内容！
　　1分钟搞定听力技巧——独到的技巧点拨，磨刀不误砍柴工！
　　1分钟英语开口说——地道口语表达精讲，听说两不误！
　　30秒速记单词——新闻词汇，快速巩固！

目录：

Part I 慢速英语
News01 美国学生贷款前景堪忧
Prospect of US Student Loan Grim
听透新闻报道的脉络
News02 欧盟财政同意向希腊提供贷款援助
European Ministers Agree to Loan Greece
听透同音词
News03 维基百科关闭抗议反盗版法案
Wikipedia Closed to Protest SOPA
辨别指示代词
News04 脸谱网即将IPO
Facebook Is on Its Way to IPO
听准比较级
……

Part II 标准英语
NPR
News01 美强化导弹防御系统
America is Strengthening Missile Defenses
听准数字
News02 道指飙升房价大涨
DJI Surges, House Price Follows
听懂股票新闻
……
CNN
News41 暴风雪侵袭美国
Snowstorm Hit the United States
听透“天气预报”
News42 刀锋战士谋杀女友案新进展
New Details Emerge in Pistorius Case
听透美国的听证会
……
VOA
News48 国防开支削减承包商受损
Sequestration Cuts Hitting Defense Contractors
选择性听人名
News49 艾滋病治愈概率增加
Chance of HIV Cured Increased
听力中的双重否定
……

Part III 快速英语
News01 欧洲经济形势堪忧
Europe’s Economy is not Optimistic
听力中的数据速记
News02 奥巴马与约旦国王就叙利亚难民问题进行会谈
Obama Talks with King of Jordan on Syrian Refugees
新闻中的“小词”
News03 美国海军响应环保政策
US Warships to Turn Green
能源关键词
……

版权信息：
作　　者： 金利 主编  出  版  社： 华东理工大学出版社
出版时间： 2014年1月 版次/开本： 1/16开
页　　数： 277 I  S  B  N： 9787562836520
定　　价： 34.80元

标准新闻英语一本掌握！


从现在开始，争取听力高分！

>> 现在就去团

title: 跟主播学英语: 新闻英语说出大牌范

description:
从绘本中学习如何保护孩子创想力（二）
时间：1月9日（星期四）12:30 - 13:30
主讲老师：葛慧芳（点击关注老师的沪江部落>>>）
公开课地点：少儿大厅（点击下载CCTalk）

（本公开课只有注册用户才能参与，花5秒钟完成注册吧>>>）

每一个孩子，天生都有一双想象的翅膀，可以让他们自由的翱翔，但遗憾的是，很多的大人们因为规矩因为成见，往往不懂得欣赏孩子们充满创造力的想象世界，更别说给孩子们的飞翔提供浩瀚的天空。

所以，亲爱的爸爸妈妈们，今天让我们跟随那些永远长不大的童书作者，一起品味经典作品，且看孩子天马行空，从绘本中去学习如何保护孩子创想力。

【讲师简介】

葛慧芳（围观老师主页>>>）

湖南第一师范学院中文系副教授，担任“儿童文学”课程的教学，沉溺于童书奇幻的世界，热心儿童阅读推广。在网上利用QQ群开办系列的儿童文学公益讲座，并建立“儿童阅读指导”微信公众平台和新浪微博“儿童阅读指导”
进行儿童阅读推广。开发有“绘本里的育儿经”系列课程。期待有更多的人同行，让孩子们的童年浸染书香。

【课程大纲】

接纳与包容——《小野人》也会玩《艺术大魔法》

15元包邮原价40儿童绘本5册>>>

本次课程完全免费，您需要做的就是：下载沪江全新语音学习软件--CCtalk>>点击下载

请注意！参与本活动须使用沪江全新语音学习软件CCTalk，使用指南如下：

1. 注册沪江网获得用户名（已是沪江用户的不必注册）；
2. 点击网址http://class.hujiang.com/zt/cctalk/下载CCtalk软件；
3. 软件安装结束后，输入沪江网的用户名和密码登陆CCtalk；
4. 点击下图中用红圈标注的“语音ABC”；

5. 找到“少儿大厅”位置，点击进入；

6. 讲座期间进入少儿大厅后，如果想发言，请点击下图中的“举手”（蓝色按钮），被主持人选中后就可以发言。说话的时候可以看到麦克进度条在随麦克声音发生变化，别人说话也可以看到耳机或扬声器的进度条在变化。

title: 沪江小D每日一句壁纸(12.30-01.05)

description:
-Albert Brennaman is a good man. In fact, Albert Brennaman is a great man. And then you're mad at me for what I do for a living?
-I've already got your number... so why don't you go consult your conscience?
-Albert is in love with her.What do you have against Allegra anyway?My interest is protecting women from assholes like you.
-You don't even know me.
-And whose fault is that?
-There are certain aspects of my job that are secretive. And my job is to try to find the truth.
-The truth? You wouldn't know the truth if it kicked you in the head.
-If Albert Brennaman has to take a fall for it, so be it.
-Why don't you say what's really pissing you off?
-Hi. Actually, you're not supposed to move.
-I work for a small publishing house in the press department... which isn't actually where I want to be. But it's a good house...
-You handled me. You manipulated me. You researched me and you showed me my great-grandfather's signature.
-Does it ever occur to women that maybe a guy might like to have a plan... because he's nervous? He's not sure that he could just walk up to you and you'd respond if he said: "I like you."
-That sounds good to me.
-True, you can't tell them you like them.
-I tried that. It didn't go well.
-I' ve crashed and burned on that. That is what you did, and I did like you! I just didn't know I was being worked over by some professional.
Manipulate
vt.操作，处理；巧妙地控制；操纵；[医] 推拿，调整
He is a very difficult character. He manipulates people...
他是个极难对付的角色，总是把人玩弄于股掌之间。
She was unable, for once, to control and manipulate events...
她仅有一次没能控制和处理好局势。
His mind moves in quantum leaps, manipulating ideas and jumping on to new ones as soon as he can.
他的脑子飞快地转着，分析着各种想法，还不时冒出新的点子来。
So they can manipulate you into making irrational decisions.
这样，他们能够操纵你做出非理性的决策。
Conscience
n.良心；道德心
I have battled with my conscience over whether I should actually send this letter...
我备受良心的煎熬，不知是否真的应该把这封信寄出去。
I'm so glad he had a pang of conscience...
我很高兴他会有负疚感。
You answer to no-one but your conscience.
你只听从于你自己的良心。
A clear conscience is number one.
清白的良心才应该排在第一名。 

-This? I figured maybe if my heart stops beating, it wouldn't hurt so much.
-She hasn't called back?
-I want you to fix it.
-I got nothing, Albert.
-You wanna do something? We should get out tonight.
-Honestly, I never knew I could feel like this. I swear I' m going out of my mind. I wanna throw myself off of every building in New York. I see a cab and I wanna dive in front of it, because then I' II stop thinking about her.
-Look, you will. Just give it time.
-That's just it. I don't want to. I've waited my whole life to feel this miserable. If this is the only way I can stay connected with her... then this is who I have to be.
-No, you don't. You can change, you can adapt. You can make it so you don't ever have to feel like this. Ever again.
-Oh, my God. You just don't get it, do you?
-I get it.
-Let me get this straight.
-You're selling this stuff, but you don't believe in your own product.
-Love is my life.
-No. Love is your job.
-You wanna jump out a plane without a chute, be my guest.
-But forgive me if I don't join you. This isn't about love for you at all, is it? This whole time, I thought I was the coward.
Throw 及其动词短语的用法
一、Throw 的基本用法
v.（动词）threw, thrown， throwing, throwsv.tr.（及物动词）
To put on or off hastily or carelessly:便穿上,仓促或不认真地穿上或脱下;
To devote, apply, or direct: 奉献、运用或导向;
The cheerful and optimistic rabbit threw himself into looking for the carrot, digging here and there, totally convinced that he would find it.
Threw the blame onto the others.他们集中全部力量进行新的尝试；怪罪别人
She threw me a look of encouragement.她向我投来鼓励的目光
博取同情：尤指为了取得宽大或支持而将（自己）置于：
Threw himself on the mercy of the court将自己置于法庭的怜惘之下

n.（名词）The act or an instance of throwing.丢;扔的动作或事例;

Throw 及其动词短语
Throw away =To get rid of as useless:抛弃，扔掉;作为无用而除去;
Threw away yesterday's newspaper.扔掉昨天的报纸;
To fail to take advantage of:丧失，错过;未能利用;
Threw away a chance to make a fortune.丧失赚大钱的机会;
Throw back阻止…的前进；扼制;
The troops were thrown back.部队的前进被阻住了;
Throw in插入,插入或引入某事的进展;
Throw off=To cast out; rid oneself of:扔出；摆脱;
Threw off all unpleasant memories.摆脱所有令人不快的回忆;
To distract, divert, or mislead:使犯错误，产生错觉;使分心、转移或误导;
Crossing the stream, he threw the tracking dogs off. 他淌过小溪把跟踪的狗甩掉了。

轻易地作出：以散漫或不关心的态度去做、完成或实现；轻而易举地完成;
Threw off a quick response to the letter.一挥而就地写了封回信;
Throw out=To give off; emit:发出；射出;
Searchlights throwing out powerful beams.探照灯发出强烈的光线
To get rid of as useless:丢弃，扔掉;扔掉无用之物;
Threw out the garbage.把垃圾扔掉;
To abandon; relinquish.放弃；停止;
She threw up her campaign for mayor.她退出了市长竞选
To refer to something repeatedly:屡次提起;
She threw up his past to him whenever they argued.一发生争执她就向他提起他的过去
To project, play, or otherwise display (a slide, videotape, or other recorded image):
Throw up (one's) hands暗示或表示绝望;
He threw up his hands and abandoned the argument.他举手放弃了争论.

title: 《全民情敌》笔记5：Love is life
